intro: Ammannia attenuata, commonly known as the slender ammannia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Lythraceae, which includes plants such as poinsettias and carnations. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, thriving in moist, sunny conditions. Its small, pinkish-white flowers bloom in clusters, and it has slender, branching stems. The leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a reddish tinge, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
